attributes.action: acknowledge and praise, in The House of Commons, the determined work of Miss Joanna Lumley in her support of The Gurkhas in their campaign for  rights of settlement in the UK.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Miss Lumley has campaigned tirelessly on behalf of The Gurkhas, in their pursuit of fair treatment by the country for which they have offered their lives; and has been instrumental in orchestrating the public pressure which resulted in the defeat, on 29 April 2009, of the Government's inadequate proposals in respect of Gurkha rights to settlement in the UK. In so doing, she has, also, demonstrated that the Prime Minister's moral compass has gone haywire.

rejection.details: Your petition does not make a point about government policy. We suggest you contact the Cabinet Office as they are actively seeking nominations for honours from the public. Please go to http://www.direct.gov.uk/honours
reasons: Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
